org.apache.ignite.igfs

Interface IgfsFile


  • public interface IgfsFile
    IGFS file or directory descriptor. For example, to get information about a file you would use the following code: 
         IgfsPath filePath = new IgfsPath("my/working/dir", "file.txt");

     // Get metadata about file.
     IgfsFile file = igfs.info(filePath);

      Gets file's data block size.

      Gets file group block size (i.e. block size * group size).

      • path

        Gets path to file.
        Returns:
        Path to file.

      • isFile

        boolean isFile()
        Check this file is a data file.
        Returns:
        True if this is a data file.

      • isDirectory

        boolean isDirectory()
        Check this file is a directory.
        Returns:
        True if this is a directory.

      • length

        long length()
        Gets file's length.
        Returns:
        File's length or zero for directories.

      • blockSize

        int blockSize()
        Gets file's data block size.
        Returns:
        File's data block size or zero for directories.

      • groupBlockSize

        long groupBlockSize()
        Gets file group block size (i.e. block size * group size).
        Returns:
        File group block size.

      • accessTime

        long accessTime()
        Gets file last access time. File last access time is not updated automatically due to performance considerations and can be updated on demand with IgniteFileSystem.setTimes(IgfsPath, long, long) method.

        By default last access time equals file creation time.

        Returns:
        Last access time.

      • modificationTime

        long modificationTime()
        Gets file last modification time. File modification time is updated automatically on each file write and append.
        Returns:
        Last modification time.

      • property

        String property(String name)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Get file's property for specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property.
        Returns:
        File's property for specified name.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If requested property was not found.

      • property

        @Nullable
String property(String name,
                       @Nullable
                       String dfltVal)
        Get file's property for specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property.
        dfltVal - Default value if requested property was not found.
        Returns:
        File's property for specified name.

        Get properties of the file.
        Returns:
        Properties of the file.
